issue.title: [C++] Run include-what-you-use checks as nightly build
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-3419](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-3419). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
As part of linting (and running linter checks in a separate Travis entry), we should also run include-what-you-use on changed files so that we can force include cleanliness

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-3419?focusedCommentId=16636749) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
As one small complication, IWYU needs to be able to see the header files for all the libraries in the toolchain. So we need to install the toolchain to be able to run these checks

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-3419?focusedCommentId=16687256) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
This might be better as a nightly build that can be perused as desired...

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-3419?focusedCommentId=16761839) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
I changed the title to make this a nightly build

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-3419?focusedCommentId=16867832) by Francois Saint-Jacques (fsaintjacques):*
This is already the case, see <https://github.com/ursa-labs/crossbow/branches/all?page=1&query=nightly-480&utf8=%E2%9C%93>
